verbs.description: herniate (third-person singular simple present herniates, present participle herniating, simple past and past participle herniated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) Of a tissue, structure, or part of an organ: to protrude through the muscular tissue or the membrane by which it is normally contained, causing a hernia.
examples: When small bowel herniates into the groin, one has an inguinal hernia.
